body:
Schema:

```
CREATE TABLE t1 (
  id bigint not null,
  PRIMARY KEY (id)
) ENGINE=InnoDB;
```

vschema (unsharded, the only keyspace):

```
{
    "ks1": {
        "sharded": false,
        "tables": {
            "t1": {}
        },
        "vindexes": {}
    }
}
```

Now use vtexplain:

This query works:

```
texplain -schema-file minimal_schema.sql -vschema-file minimal_vschema.json -shards 1 -sql 'INSERT INTO t1 (id) select 1 from t1 where not exists (select id from t1 where id = 2);'
----------------------------------------------------------------------
INSERT INTO t1 (id) select 1 from t1 where not exists (select id from t1 where id = 2)

1 ks1/-: begin
1 ks1/-: select 1 from t1 where not exists (select id from t1 where id = 2) limit 10001
1 ks1/-: insert into t1(id) values (1)
1 ks1/-: commit

----------------------------------------------------------------------
```

However, if we (just) replace the table reference in the select with dual, we get an error:

```
vtexplain -schema-file minimal_schema.sql -vschema-file minimal_vschema.json -shards 1 -sql 'INSERT INTO t1 (id) select 1 from dual where not exists (select id from t1 where id = 2);'
ERROR: vtexplain execute error in 'INSERT INTO t1 (id) select 1 from dual where not exists (select id from t1 where id = 2)': unsupported: sharded subquery in insert values
``` 

I don't see any reason why this shouldn't just work.

The real query is rather more complex, but reduces to this, and there doesn't seem to be a simple workaround.
title: Vitess seems to treat inserts with subselects involving DUAL as sharded, even when keyspace is unsharded?
